main event: On the evening of December 20, 1957, multiple sightings of a bright, white, wheel-shaped object flying at varying speeds and directions were reported over Taichung, Formosa (now Taiwan). The object was described as being 10 times brighter than stars and appeared to be dropping white material to the northwest.
interesting points: The object was observed at high speed, fading to the northeast, and noted to be significantly brighter than stars in the sky.
It was also observed flying slowly with white material seeming to drip to the northwest, and later observed shooting slowly to the south.
The sightings involved reports from various sources, including observations through telescopes and at different locations within the area.
The reports indicated that the object remained stationary at times before fading, and no sound or light associated with the object dropping white material was reported.
The sightings occurred over a span of several hours and there were no reported scramble actions in response to the UFOs.
